result.execSummary:
The defendant Jmontae L Bogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery AMENDED FROM ARMED ROBBERY [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically cognitive intervention. Must get high school diploma or HSED. A GED is not acceptable. No contact with any of the named co-defendants or with the victim. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Matter on the calendar today because the defendant had a change of heart based upon the implications of the agreement. The State indicates they still intend to amend the information. When the defendant changed his mind, the State was allowed to withdraw the information. The State proposes to amend information to attempted armed robbery.  

Defense makes speedy trial request

BTC: Amended information may be filed by the State and the process of filing the amended info/entering the plea to the amended charges will be completed on MH date.  Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
In 15CF487, the State amends the charge to attempted Robbery, PTAC and recommends 4 yrs WPS equal bifurcation - this is a stipulated agreement. 15CF950 is DRI. In 15CF1871, the defendant will plead to Ct 3. Cts 1 & 2 are DRI. The State recommends 3 yrs probation. The State stands silent on expungement.

ALONG WITH $23,000.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND TO BE SIGNED WITH MOTHER, LAKESHA SHELBY, DOB 03-29-1979 WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 943.32(2)- Armed Robbery.  No contact with the victim BC (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant. TG & ST.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are medical appointments, attorney visits and court hearings. May not communicate via social media including Twitter. No visitors allowed in the home. Defendant is to be fully compliant with rules of mother's home.
Pre-trial conference on May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for reduction in bail. Parties indicates deft was a victim of a shooting that affected his heart and his medical condition is fragile. Defense is asking, based on his medical condition, that bond be modified and deft be placed on house arrest/GPS with exception only for court, attorney visits, and medical appointments.  The deft's mother Lakesha Shelby 3/29/79 can post some cash and will co-sign for deft.

BTC: modify bond - $25000.00 - $2000.00 cash, balance co-signature to be co-signed with Lakesha Shelby DOB 03-29-1979. GPS/house arrest with exceptions only for medical appointments, attorney meetings and court. All dates, times and locations to be monitored by ZCI. May not communicate via social media at all. No visitors at the home. Defendant is to be fully compliant with all rules of mother's home. All other conditions remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
For Reduction of Bail
